did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Albert C. Phelps lecture notes and diary, [ca.1900-1931].
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Lecture notes for Phelps' courses in architecture at Cornell and a diary of daily life and a trip to Europe.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Albert Charles Phelps came to Cornell in 1899 as an instructor, was appointed an assistant professor in 1903, and a full professor in 1913. He became the World War Memorial Professor of Architecture in 1920, a position he held until his death in 1937. A fellow of the American Institute of Architects, Professor Phelps specialized in the history of architecture.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Lecture notes for Phelps' courses in architecture at Cornell and a diary of daily life and a trip to Europe in 1930-1931.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Albert Charles Phelps lecture notes and diary, #15-2-1001. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
